newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Pertamina to restart Balongan cracker.
newsitem.headline: Pertamina to restart Balongan cracker.

text.p: Indonesia's state-owned oil company Pertamina will resume operations at its Balongan 83,000-barrel-per-day long residue catalytic cracker later on Thursday after an unexpected shutdown on February 6, sources close to the refinery said on Thursday.
The source said Pertamina was hoping to successfully restart the unit later Thursday but was not able to confirm if the unit was already operational.
Pertamina had shutdown the cracker in November for a 60-day scheduled maintenance while the crude unit was closed at the same time for a shorter 30-day period.

The company will close its 125,000-bpd Dumai crude unit in mid-February for maintenance as scheduled earlier. Sources said the company had earlier this week closed a 27,500-bpd hydrocracker ahead of the crude unit's closure.
